Topic.Title: AMD UP 13%, QCOM UP 1% AND TXN UP 2.5%...NVDA DOWN!

Message.Msg: I surely don't have the answer. But when the stock of a fundamentally strong company trades like a dog laden with fleas something must be wrong. The only reason that comes to mind is the possibility that many of NVDA employees are cashing in on their stock options. If anyone else has any other reason I would be very grateful to hear it. Have all a very nice day.

Anyone dumb enough to pay $800 for a SHIELD toy running on a ~$25 Tegra part to play space invaders is a certified space cadet and should also probably purchase the $900 flash light with a tollet paper cyclinder attached as the matching toy ray gun. lol imho

Not true. ask me last year if anyone would buy 3 or 4 $1000 Titan cards to play video games and I would have thought you nuts. But guess what they are doing! Want something lower priced? We've got that covered with the ouya. And more middle of the road gaming devices coming I'm sure. Can't wait for the first telecom to announce they will be offering online gaming for fee. Do you think they will subsidize the Shield as incentive? By the way are they going to stick with that name? What is project "Thor". Wasn't he the Norse god who could bring down the hammer?
really helpful

I wouldn't be surprised about the $1,000 video cards - the PC hardware enthusiast scene is quite active, which is why despite the doom & gloom about PC death, Nvidia still does well financially. People who build hardcore gamer rigs have money. And they hate consoles. $800 for a handheld video game device is not what the hardcore enthusiasts will buy, that's why they need to be aimed at the mainstream console kiddies. And those console kids ain't buying an $800 Shield when a PS4 is $500.
thanks for this report

Topic.Title: AMD UP 13%, QCOM UP 1% AND TXN UP 2.5%...NVDA DOWN!

Message.Msg: The market wants to see the $ from the Tegra strategy. Until there is some real momentum with the products there (major design wins), the market will remain skeptical. Buying here is a bet against that skepticism.
